question.title: Mark text in html by complex regexps with markup save
question.body:
Here is my input HTML:

<html>
    <head></head>
    <body>
        <p>complete guide</p>
        <p>
            At the moment, we have no <span>questions</span> regarding the model and <b>logic</b> of the application, so there are no highlighted questions in the presentation. 
        </p>
    </body>
</html>

Here (https://regex101.com/r/ghp1UQ/1) is my regular expression:

complete(([^\s]*)\s){0,24}questions|questions(([^\s]*)\s){0,24}complete

and here is my desired output HTML:

<html>
    <head></head>
    <body>
        <p><mark>complete guide</mark></p>
        <p>
            <mark>At the moment, we have no</mark> <span><mark>questions</mark></span> regarding the model and <b>logic</b> of the application, so there are no highlighted questions in the presentation. 
        </p>
    </body>
</html>

Words inside a regex match must be marked, and the DOM tree must be valid.

How can this be done, for example, with jsoup?
